ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, especially with this particular instructor.
I would recommend just because of Jack Harris.

This was more of a fleshing out of the concepts I got in undergrad. Unlike the other first year grad courses, this one didn't overlap much with its undergraduate counterpart (which followed mainly griffiths) but applied those concepts to more cases, and approached quantum mechanics differently. In this cases where it did overlap, such as perturbation theory, the ideas were the same but the problems were much more difficult.
If Professor Harris is teaching the course, then you will be set for a very fulfilling course.
Yes! Especially with Prof. Jack Harris. Great class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Fundamental quantum mechanics is exceedingly relevant to my research.
This course will be essential to my research.
Looked at a more rigorous approach to quantum mechanics, and poked at subtleties that Griffiths will gloss over very quickly.
